title: A classroom’s best friend
text:
October 9 at 7:47 PM Regarding the Oct. 5 Metro article “ The teacher’s pet wants a treat ”:
One of my fondest childhood memories is of attending St. Luke’s School, a small private school in New Canaan, Conn., and seeing dogs walking through the halls.
Dogs would follow us into the classrooms, sit by our chairs, walk into the locker rooms and watch us play sports after school. It was a little strange at first, but I got quite used to the canine “students” and enjoyed their presence, especially when I felt lonely because of normal tween angst.
I wish more schools allowed animals. They teach children valuable lessons about empathy, responsibility and gentleness.
Heather Barclay , Reston
